data.proxyObjectName: red and white beverage carton with screw cap
data.utilizationMethod: Hold the top corner of the carton like a vertical handle—thumb on one panel, fingers on the opposite panel. Fill the carton with liquid to create a bottom-heavy feel, then raise and tilt it as though drinking from a mug. The rectangular body substitutes for the wooden barrel while the corner edge mimics a slender handle.

Wrap fingers firmly around the flexible headband near one earcup and let the opposite earcup swing forward as the ‘axe head.’ The two earcups supply distributed weight that pulls against the hand during broad swings, while the padded band offers a thick cylindrical grip approximating a tool handle.

data.proxyObjectName: black stainless steel water bottle with silver screw cap
data.utilizationMethod: Grip the bottle just above its lower third so that most of the mass (the full metal body and any remaining liquid) sits forward of your hand, creating a head-heavy feel. Swing downward in short arcs, letting the weight pull your wrist much like a real hammer head while your closed fingers feel the cylindrical circumference of the bottle as the handle.

data.proxyObjectName: black-handled, silver-shafted adjustable phone selfie stick
data.utilizationMethod: Hold the rubberized handle exactly as the sickle grip and keep the phone clamp folded forward to approximate the blade tip. The telescopic shaft adds forward length and modest mass, enabling realistic sweeping arcs followed by a pulling motion that produces noticeable inertia along the stick’s length.
